user_review: Won an instacontest and finally came to try this place Friday night. I'm really happy with our experience here. The man who worked there was chill, patient and knew the menu very well. We each got a poke bowl. Mine was shrimp with sesame/wasabi ginger sauces in on all dressed bowl (brown rice, avocado, pineapple, cilantro, edamame, etc). My sister got the tuna all dressed bowl with the island sauce (yum). I definitely preferred the tuna/island bowl, very strong and delicious flavours. We were also offered 2 drinks so we each tried a kombucha (hibiscus black tea / ginger green tea). Kombucha's not for me but I'm glad I tried it. Tucked away near the Jean Talon Market and Little Italy, Ok Poke is worth trying if in the area. Fresh, healthy poke bowls for $9 are the way to go!

I had been wanting to try a Poké bowl here for a while, but it was (like the name suggests) OK... I'm a chef, and I'm what I appreciate about a poke bowl is that the ingredients have to be fresh. They're not complicated to make, so that raises my expectations. I had the salmon all dressed bowl with avocado, and while the ingredients were fresh, the fish quality was low, and the rice was slightly overcooked and too starchy. If all you serve is poké bowls and the only thing you need to cook is rice, it should be perfect... Food aside,  the service was friendly, but the decor was all over the place and felt like I was in someone's messy office... Just really missed the mark for me unfortunately.

The perfect new dining option near Marché Jean Talon for lunch or dinner, with bonus local art en plus!Ok Poké is just across the street from the SAQ, and Premiere Moisson, and all the new Muskoka chairs and rocking chairs and assorted public space sweetness at the west end of Montreal's biggest and best farmer's market. It's got big bright windows, simple and lovely design, and a few comfortable tables where you can sit and eat and watch the world go by. There is a tiny but exceptionally well-curated selection of local art, prints, essential oils, candles and other things giving good vibes, and a nice collection of foodie grocery finds as well. But the main appeal is the food. Definitely the best poké I've had. I'm eating vegetarian so I went for the tofu and was so happy to find it flavourful and perfectly cooked, and generally generous piled with big chunks of avocado, lots of soy beans, a homemade sauce I want to put on everything, piles more. I tried it with the homemade green juice which was perfect, not sweet, just great. Go get it.
Services and quality differs from one cook to an other. I would recommend the salmon poke with des isles sauce. Cute place though.

It's definitely the worst place I've tried.Nothing was working.. not even one good thing to say. We We're three ppl and not one liked it. No flavor...  really. Asked no coriander and had some pieces in. My friend asked no onions they sed there's no onions today anyway but we all had some in our plate.. fish was cut like 4cm long.. ?? If at least the flavor was there.. but absolutely not!You might go to jean talon market and buy a piece of bread.

If you want to eat super well thought-out, fresh and delicious meals from one of Montreal's best chefs, check out this new and hidden gem in Montreal right beside Jean Talon market. They often offer incredible special brunch menu's too!
Yes! fresh ingredients, good price, nice decor & staff. Just do it!

Adorable poke shop next to the jean talon market. This is a "build it yourself" type poke shop which means you need to know what flavour combos you like. Staff was super friendly and loved their items for sale... sage, crystals... all to give a good vibe. I have a feeling this place will become my "go to" for the area.
So lucky to have this restaurant in our neighbourhood. Fresh, tasty, friendly laid back atmosphere and great service. I've come several times and it is consistently a wonderful experience.
Delicious poke with amazing homemade sauces. The fish is sooooooo fresh. And they have the best pies!!
